alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Southeast Yuma County; Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 20 at 8:13PM MST until August 21 at 12:00AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Arizona, including the following areas, Central La Paz, Gila River Valley, Kofa, Parker Valley, Southeast Yuma County and Yuma. Portions of California, including the following areas, Chiriaco Summit, Chuckwalla Mountains, Chuckwalla Valley, Imperial County Southeast, Imperial County Southwest, Imperial County West, Imperial Valley, Joshua Tree NP East, Joshua Tree NP West, Palo Verde Valley and Salton Sea. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Area creeks and streams are running high and could flood with more heavy rain. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Tropical cyclone Hilary continues to bring rainfall, moderate at times, to portions of Southern California. Any additional rainfall tonight will add to the already widespread rainfall since yesterday, potentially leading to further flash flooding or continuing the flooding that is already ongoing. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa; Parker Valley; Southeast Yuma County; Yuma
